info.title: ScreenCapture API
info.description: The `ScreenCapture` plugin is used to upload screen captures.

uploadScreenCapture.summary:
Takes a screenshot and uploads it to the specified URL. A screenshot is uploaded using raw HTTP POST request as binary image/png data. It's the same as running the following command:  
`wget -d -q -O - --header='Content-Type: application/octet-stream' --post-file=/path/to/screenshot.png http://server/cgi-bin/upload.cgi`  
or,  
`curl -F image=@/path/to/screenshot.png http://server/cgi-bin/upload.cgi`  
For implementation details, see `bool ScreenCapture::uploadDataToUrl(std::vector<unsigned char> &data, const char *url, std::string &error_str)`.

events.uploadComplete: Triggered after uploading a screen capture with status and message

callGUID.summary: A unique identifier of a call. The identifier is used to find a corresponding `uploadComplete` event

uploadComplete.summary: Triggered after uploading a screen capture

status.summary: Indicates if the upload was successful

message.summary: A `Success` value indicates that the upload was successful; otherwise, a description of the failure

call_guid.summary: A unique identifier of the call
